Metronome |website = }} '''Marsha Thornton''' (born October 22, 1964, in [[Killen, Alabama]]) is a female [[country music]] singer. Between 1990 and 2003, she released three studio albums, with her first two released on [[MCA Records]]; she has also issued four singles on the [[Hot Country Songs]] charts. Her highest peaking single was "A Bottle of Wine and Patsy Cline", written by Lindy Gravelle, which reached No. 59 in 1990.
